owl:Ontology.dc:creator: María Poveda-Villalón (Ontology Engineering Group, Universidad Politécnica de Madrid)
Serge Chávez-Feria (Ontology Engineering Group, Universidad Politécnica de Madrid)
owl:Ontology.dc:description: The material properties ontology provides the vocabulary to describe physical properties related to components, materials and layer in a building context. The ontology follows the L2 level modelling strategy proposed by the W3C LBD community group for the creation of properties. The L2 level states the usage of an intermediate instance for each property which encodes both the numerical value and the unit of measure.
owl:Ontology.dc:title: Material properties ontology

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: abiotic depletion potential for non fossil resources (ADPE)
abiotic depletion potential for fossil resources (ADPF)
acidification potential of soil and water (AP)
back side solar reflectance at normal incidence (BSSRNI)
back side visible reflectance at normal incidence (BSVRNI)
front side visible reflectance at normal incidence (FSVRNI)
use of non renewable secondary fuels (NRSF)
depletion potential of the stratospheric layer (ODP)
use of non renewable primary energy (PENRE)
use of non renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials (PENRM)
total use of non renewable primary energy resource (PENRT)
use of renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials (PERM)
total use of renewable primary energy (PERT)
window glass spectral data set name (WGSDSN)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Properties related to a layer element.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Layer Property

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Properties used in the building construction sector for the different elements involved.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Property
